requirements.criteria_1: The proposed project shall not have a negative impact on the transportation level of service.
requirements.criteria_2: The new development shall mitigate any impacts it may have on the scale character of existing residential sites abutting the proposed project.
requirements.criteria_3: The applicant shall enter into a developers agreement with the city committing to the number of affordable units approved and ensuring that the units will remain affordable for a period of time to be designated by the Council.

bonuses.feature_name: Vertical mixed-use (residential and commercial or office)

bonuses.conditions: A minimum of 25% of total units in development shall be affordable. Developer's agreement committing to keeping the units affordable for a minimum of 30 years.

bonuses.density_bonus: 2 additional units per acre for every 3,000 sq. ft. of amenities
bonuses.intensity_bonus: 0.02 additional FAR for every 3,000 sq. ft. of amenities
bonuses.height_bonus: 1 story for every 3,000 sq. ft. of amenities
bonuses.conditions: Urban plaza or park with amenities, at least three thousand (3,000) square feet in area or multi-use trails connecting to other systems outside the development. The amenities shall be privately-owned and maintained, but open to the public.

bonuses.feature_name: Parking garage under residential, office or commercial development
bonuses.height_bonus: 1 additional floor per garage level provided
bonuses.conditions: The facade facing the street shall incorporate active uses (residential, commercial or office)

bonuses.feature_name: Access to Waterfront (Turkey Creek, Palm Bay, and the Indian River Lagoon)
bonuses.conditions: One or combination of the following: 1. View of the water from the public right-of-way (in the form of breezeways); 2. Access to the water in the form of boat ramps, fishing piers, or beach; 3. Outdoor dining facing the water.

Designs shall, at a minimum, manage and capture stormwater runoff, to the maximum extent feasible, in a manner consistent with the integrated management practices (IMPs) as outlined in the City's Low Impact Development Manual.

bonuses.feature_name: Emergency storm shelters in mobile home or RV parks
bonuses.conditions: Shelters which meet the design and construction requirements established within the latest 'ICC 500 ICC/NSSA Standard for the Design and Construction of Storm Shelters'

bonuses.feature_name: Use of living shoreline techniques to prevent shoreline erosion
bonuses.parking_reduction: Reduced parking (up to 10% of the minimum number of spaces required)

bonuses.feature_name: Co-location of water-dependent and water-related uses
bonuses.parking_reduction: Reduced parking (up to 10% of the minimum number of spaces required)
bonuses.conditions: Minimum of 2 water-dependent uses; or 1 water-dependent and 1 water-related uses. Uses must be located within the same structure or provide cross access via a shared pedestrian pathway.

note: Where the features listed above are already required by the Land Development Code, they shall be provided without a bonus.
